strategy: Individual question articles with topic clusters

individual_articles.parent_topic_title: [SOLVED] - App shows different plan workout than Website
individual_articles.user_pain_point: Confusion over different workout displays on app vs. website.
individual_articles.user_question: When I look at the App (iphone and ipad), it shows one workout, but when I look on the website, it shows a different one. The app shows workouts numbered… #1, #2, etc… but not on the calendar?? Very confused. Why doesn’t the app show the scheduled workouts like the website?
individual_articles.suggested_article_title: How to View Your Training Calendar in the TrainerDay App

individual_articles.parent_topic_title: [SOLVED] - App shows different plan workout than Website
individual_articles.user_pain_point: N/A
individual_articles.user_question: Got it - Thanks!! I activated “My Calendar” and now I see the correct workout on my app. Also, now when I click on “Workouts” it shows me the list of workouts with their dates - which is basically the calendar view I was looking for. Thanks for the fast responses!
individual_articles.suggested_article_title: How to View Your Training Calendar in the TrainerDay App

individual_articles.parent_topic_title: [SOLVED] - iOS App crashing after peak of TD Ramp Test
individual_articles.user_pain_point: Discarding the workout also causes the app to crash.
individual_articles.user_question: Hey there and thank you for replying so quick. I‘d to talk to you dev about this. I did try to discard, but this made the app crash as well.
individual_articles.suggested_article_title: Troubleshooting TrainerDay App Crashes

individual_articles.parent_topic_title: [SOLVED] - Coach Jack not working
individual_articles.user_pain_point: Getting a blank screen when trying to use Coach Jack.
individual_articles.user_question: Just rejoined after a period of just riding and when trying to use coach Jack in the web app I’m just getting a blank screen. Any ideas? Many thanks.
individual_articles.suggested_article_title: Fixing Coach Jack Blank Screen Issues

individual_articles.parent_topic_title: IOS App won't finish workout and crashes
individual_articles.user_pain_point: App crashes on save, uncertainty about iOS update impact.

Iphone 12, iOS 18.2, and I was connected to an Elite trainer and Wahoo Tickr. There’s an iOS update, worth a try or will installing that delete t

individual_articles.parent_topic_title: IOS App won't finish workout and crashes
individual_articles.user_pain_point: App crashes on save, confusion about reloading the app.
individual_articles.user_question: I’m having the same issue. -iPhone 11 -Finished FTP test, push the stop button, it shows the name/save window, and then when pushing save, it crashes -No other apps running Is a re-load of the app just me closing and then opening the app? (but I’ll lose the workout?), or is it a delete and re-instal
individual_articles.suggested_article_title: How to Save Workouts When TrainerDay App Crashes

individual_articles.parent_topic_title: [SOLVED] - App shows different plan workout than Website

individual_articles.parent_topic_title: [SOLVED] - iOS App crashing after peak of TD Ramp Test
individual_articles.user_pain_point: App crashes when trying to save after stopping a workout.
individual_articles.user_question: Hey there I am following up, because I do have the same error again. After stopping the workout, I just can’t save without having the app crash. I reinstalled multiple times. Any chance of some more debugging? In this state, the App has become unusable to me.
individual_articles.suggested_article_title: How to Save Workouts When TrainerDay App Crashes

individual_articles.parent_topic_title: [SOLVED] - iOS App crashing after peak of TD Ramp Test
individual_articles.user_pain_point: App crashes after reaching the peak of the ramp test.
individual_articles.user_question: Hey there, Was just reaching the peak point of the ramp test. Stopped pedaling and the App crashed. After reopening I tried to pick up the running training again. After pedaling or trying to stop the test, the App crashed again. See attached screencast for reference. iOS 18.3 on iPhone 15 Pro. Lates

individual_articles.parent_topic_title: [SOLVED] - iOS App crashing after peak of TD Ramp Test

individual_articles.user_question: The trainer is a Tacx Neo Smart T2800. It has been working flawlessly together with TrainerDay App on multiple iPads in my household. individual_articles.parent_topic_title: Zone 2 computation
individual_articles.user_pain_point: Difficulty in determining the right intensity for angiogenesis without lactate testing.
individual_articles.user_question: i am trying to get angiogenesis. if i atart having lactate buildup if i understand, then that does not happen. if you exercise too lightly, same thing. how can you find the sweet spot riding for an hour and half to achieve this goal if you cannot test for lactate ? i am indeed looking for fitness/he
individual_articles.suggested_article_title: How to Fix: Difficulty in determining the right intensity for angiogenes

individual_articles.parent_topic_title: Zone 2 computation
individual_articles.user_pain_point: Discrepancy in heart rate zone calculations between devices.
individual_articles.user_question: I do not think that has been asked before but whoop introduced zone training in their app. The HR zones do not match my garmin. They use this formula Target HR Intensity Zone = ((Max HR − Resting HR) × %Intensity) + Resting HR If i use their zone system, my zone 2 limits are not the same as my garmi
individual_articles.suggested_article_title: Setting Up Zone 2 Training in TrainerDay
